description: Dive into "Sun-Kissed Shores of Nice" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Sun-Kissed Shores of Nice

places.generalDescription: Bocca Mar is a beachside restaurant in Nice that offers a daily special of 2 courses on weekdays. The setting provides a sunny lunch with the sound of waves, making it an ideal spot to enjoy a meal. It's recommended to share starters and desserts while ordering mains for an optimal dining experience. Additionally, Bocca Mar operates as a beach club with easy online reservation and bed booking, providing comfortable amenities such as cushions and umbrellas for a fee.

sources.snippet: Close to the old town of Nice, you’ll find an excellent modern Mediterranean beach club, Bocca Mar. One of the more refined options on the Promenade, they offer some great food with a relaxed beach area. It’s a good option if really don’t want to walk too far to from the Old Town and they have the brilliant option of reserving both tables and sunloungers on their website.
sources.shortName: Guide to the Best Beach Clubs in Nice

sources.snippet: Bocca Mar beach not only has the best-priced sun-beds at 20€ including the parasol (30€ for the front row, 25€ for second row), but also has good food, from the same owners as local favorite Bocca Nissa in the Old Town. Across from the Palais de Mediterranee Hyatt hotel, tram stop Massena.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Nice 2024

sources.snippet: It’s an offshoot of the popular  Bocca Nissa rooftop restaurant on the Cours Saleya. So, it comes as no surprise that the food at Bocca Mar is delicious, with plenty of Mediterranean options meant to be shared. A resident DJ sets the tone from Thursday to Sunday during the high season.
sources.shortName: 10 best beaches in Nice on the Promenade des Anglais and beyond

places.name: Bocca Mar

reviews.text: Bocca Mar is an absolute must-visit in Nice! We had a lovely dinner there and we were very positively surprised by both the food and even more by the service. Our waiter Kevin was beyond anything we could have hoped for - he's a real treasure! And the food itself was delightful, we loved the idea of all foods being shared on the table. PS: the chocolate tablet is a divine option for dessert!

What an unexpected unforgettable lunch experienced we had here. We were assisted by a very charming, kind and attentive server named Kevin. He was so approachable and good in dealing with guests with kids. He explained everything so well in french and English since some of us doesn't speak french. What a plus!

Food were great and the ambiance is so majestic. We high'y recommend this restaurant. A must visit when you go to Nice.

We were able to visit two beach clubs on our trip and this one was far superior! It's definitely pricey but the whole are is, and we did front row loungers, but the food was some of our favorite on our entire trip. There was great service and it was such a relaxing day! Our reservation was for 9:30AM and we stayed until they closed. Take your water shoes and enjoy a beautiful day at the beach club! Make reservations to guarantee your spot.

places.generalDescription: Prom. des Anglais is a 7-km-long beachfront promenade in Nice, France, lined with palm trees and featuring a bike path. It has been a popular spot since the 18th century when English aristocrats sought refuge from winter weather. The promenade extends from the airport to Nice's old town and is home to many hotels and cafes. Visitors can enjoy seaside walks, known locally as 'the Prom,' while taking in the sea air and lively atmosphere of Nice.

sources.snippet: Just minutes from the Promenade des Anglais and beaches, the Best Western Plus Hôtel Masséna Nice is the perfect place for a seaside break in the sun. Your 4* hotel has 100 comfortable and fully-equipped rooms and suites. Whether you're staying with friends, family or alone, we have the right room type for you.
sources.shortName: The most beautiful beaches in Nice

sources.snippet: The seven-mile-long coastline called the Promenade Des Anglais has spectacular beaches. The Ruhl Plage and the Carras Beach are one of the best beaches in Nice. At the Ruhl Plage, you can find saltwater pools along the coastline of the beach, local wines, and more.
sources.shortName: Glamour By The Sea - Most Beautiful Beaches of Nice, France

sources.snippet: Wherever you are in Nice, you can go for a swim somewhere along the famous Promenade des Anglais. It’s over 7 km long and offers a whole host of options.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Nice, Côte d 'Azur - VOLARE MAGAZINE

places.name: Prom. des Anglais

reviews.text: Very beautiful, scenic and lively avenue along the coast with passengers walking around in numbers even at midnight. And the avenue is exceptionally bright, of course.

A nice promenade is a peaceful and scenic place for a leisurely walk, often along the water-be it a beach, river, or lake. It's where you feel the breeze, watch people pass by, and maybe catch a sunset. It invites relaxation, conversation, and a moment to just enjoy the view.
A very nice long road with a beautiful sea view and beaches along the way on one side, and nicely colored houses on the other.

places.generalDescription: La Réserve de Nice is an elevated dining experience set in an 1800s art deco-style venue, offering stunning sea views from its bay windows. Chef Jerome Cotta's culinary expertise shines through in the meticulously crafted dishes, such as mille-feuille of foie gras caramelized with maple syrup and cod fillet cooked in frothy butter and truffle bouillon.

sources.snippet: This was by far my favorite beach discovery while in Nice for a few reasons: it’s within walking distance, there’s a ladder so that you don’t have to slip over the pebbles while getting in the water and it’s super local. Right past the port, it also features an awesome (although technically off-limits) diving board–shown in the first photo in this post. Watching the reckless teenage boys shimmy up to the top and then jump off is afternoon entertainment in itself.
sources.siteName: C'est Christine - Solo Female Travel & Lifestyle Blog
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Nice

sources.snippet: La Reserve is one of the best beaches in Nice, at least when you’re comparing public beaches. It can be found close to the city center, and you’ll find plenty of teenagers and locals. This beach isn’t located on the main large beach of Nice, and this means that there will be substantially fewer tourists here, and the majority of people will be locals, thus allowing for smaller crowds compared to the beaches of the main Nice beach.
sources.shortName: The complete list of The Best Beaches in Nice

sources.snippet: If public beaches are more your thing, then you should definitely visit La Reserve, one of our favourite public beaches in Nice. However, don’t think that because it is a public beach that there will be hordes of tourists lounging on this beach. La Reserve takes the crown among other public beaches in Nice because of how secluded it is.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches in Nice | Nice Travel Guide
A Local’s Guide – NiceFunTours

places.name: La Réserve de Nice

reviews.text: The tall head host is a lovely gentleman. The other staff members were terrific as well. The food is sophisticated and haute and delicious. This was my first time at a fine dinning establishment. Everything was beautiful, especially the view. Too bad the weather ruined it. But the atomosphere was perfect. Highly recommend.

STUNNING VIEWS and excellent bar menu on the rooftop! Make a reservation because the space isn't large, and it's a terrific spot for a cocktail before dinner or for just cocktails and snacks. My husband and I enjoyed awesome gin and tonics and a yummy grilled cheese panini. There were many good choices on the menu-- not your typical bar chips and nuts. Classy atmosphere and friendly staff who spoke English too. You could drink and linger for a while. We took an Uberso can't comment on parking.

Our first time visiting Nice, so La Réserve was a bit of a shot in the dark booking but it really paid off.  Scheduled a sunset viewing time and the scenery was magnificent .  The food was even better.  We were nearing the end of two week vacation mostly in Italy where the food was fantastic.  This was our best dinner of the whole trip.  The fish just melted in my mouth and my wife thoroughly enjoyed her beef.  We unfortunately didn't take our waiters advice to preorder the cherry dessert but the other two options made up for any disappointment.  Can't recommend La Réserve any higher.

places.generalDescription: Castel Plage is a stunning waterfront location situated at the far end of the Promenade des Anglais under Castle Hill in Nice. This private beach offers a Mediterranean-style seafood restaurant, artisanal ice cream, and beach rentals. Visitors can rent beach beds for half or full days and make reservations in advance. The beach provides a perfect setting for sunbathing and swimming in its vivid blue waters.

sources.snippet: Castel Beach is considered by many to be the best private beach in Nice. It’s at the end of them all, tucked under the headland and away from the hustle and bustle. The loungers are comfortable, the food is great, the service is generally considered good — which isn’t true of every other beach restaurant in Nice — and the clientele calm.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Beaches In Nice, France

sources.snippet: until midnight from April to September, the private Castel Plage, which sits at the far end of the Promenade des Anglais under Castle Hill, is a top pick for those looking to spend an entire day basking by the water, pausing for lunch in between dips in the sea. Beach beds can be rented for half (17 euros) or full days (20 euros), but if you want to ensure you’ll have a bed ready and waiting when you arrive, call and reserve the day before (specifying which row you’d like). This is the kind of spot that’s perfect for lingering on Sundays in summer, sipping Provençal rosé while dining on the restaurant’s Niçois-inspired menu (which can be ordered seaside) with ingredients pulled right from the local market.
sources.shortName: The 10 Best Beaches in Nice, France

sources.snippet: Home to both a private beach club and a public beach, this Eastern stretch of pebbles is situated in the shadows of the beautiful Castle Hill overlooking the port and city center. The private beach offers sun loungers and luxury experiences like delicious cocktails (more often than not an Aperol spritz) and food from the stylish Art-Deco Ascenseur du Château restaurant. The public beach is slightly more crowded but offers comfortable swimming conditions on the Baie des Anges and the same exact views as the private beach club.
sources.shortName: 7 beaches near Nice: Where to go for sun, sand, and surf

sources.snippet: It has the most picturesque location, at the foot of the Chateau cliffs, across from the old town, and at the top of the Promenade des Anglais with a stunning panorama of the whole bay. The décor is belle epoch/art deco, the food is creative and delicious, if pricy, and this beach has the most artsy and eclectic clientele. …And they just got even more chic, with the addition of an oyster bar carved right into the cliff face!
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Nice 2024

sources.snippet: Castel Plage is a chic, sophisticated private beach just a short walk from the Old Town of Nice. This small but charming beach is popular for its luxurious amenities and stunning views of the Bay of Angels and the iconic Promenade des Anglais. The beach is well-equipped with sun loungers, parasols, and beachside service, making it a great spot to relax while enjoying the beautiful surroundings comfortably.
sources.siteName: Top Rated Tourist Attraction Places in France | France Travel Pages
sources.shortName: 4 Best Beaches in Nice

sources.snippet: One of the oldest establishments on La Baie des Anges and considered to be one of the best private beaches on the French Riviera, it would be a real shame to miss Castel Plage. Aptly named due to its location at the bottom of a castle, this beach is truly unique. Its restaurant offers fresh and quality seafood in an unpretentious venue as well as sun-loungers and parasols for those who want to sunbathe.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches in Nice | Nice Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Located on the very eastern edge of the beach, it’s right next to the old town and the Colline du Château. The open restaurant area is slightly raised above the beach giving probably one of the best views across the Baie des Anges. On the menu are the usual suspects with plenty of fresh, locally caught fish (cod, seabass, and sea bream).
sources.shortName: Guide to the Best Beach Clubs in Nice
10 Best Beaches in Nice, France (for Your Bucket List!)

sources.snippet: Located at the foot of the Nice Castle, Le Castel Plage is an institution in the city. With its ideal location at the eastern end of the Promenade des Anglais, this private beach offers a spectacular view of the Bay of Angels and the coastal promenade. The place is calm and conducive to relaxation and escapism.
sources.shortName: Top 5 private beaches in Nice

sources.snippet: Castel Plage is a popular private beach in Nice located just a few short steps away from the old town. Enjoy soaking up the sunshine on deckchairs and seeking shade under parasols at this luxurious section of beach. Here, you’ll get a simply stunning view of the Bay of Angels as you take a dip.
sources.shortName: 20 Beautiful Beaches & Beach Clubs in Nice, France (2025)

sources.snippet: This is regarded by many as the best private beach in the city. Castel is at the end of everything else, enclosed under the foreland and aloof from the city’s noise. The food is excellent, the loungers are comfortable, and the service is awesome, like in many other Niçoise beach restaurants.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Nice

sources.snippet: Adjacent to the Colline du Château, this private beach is decorated with a blend of old-world charm and contemporary elements. Art Deco structures and works of art from the 20th and 21st centuries (Arman, Ben…) interact in symbiosis. You really feel like you’re out of time!
sources.shortName: 11 best beaches in Nice (photos + tips)

sources.snippet: Situated below the fortifications of the old town, Castel Plage has a special charm. Nestled next to the Castle Hill, the Castel private beach is a clever blend of modernity and tradition. A huge contemporary sculpture stands in the middle of the wooden reception room.
sources.shortName: Private beaches in Nice: our guide to the best addresses!

sources.snippet: A beautiful private beach with a restaurant and rows of beach-chairs and umbrellas, Castel Plage is an art-deco paradise tucked away in the eastern-most corner of the Nice beaches. A great place to watch the sunset with a cocktail and delicious Mediterranean cuisine.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Nice: Top Spots for Sun & Sea

sources.snippet: Castel Plage is a prime spot for a day of relaxing by the Mediterranean. Their service is solid, the views are beautiful, and the food menu is extensive. Fair warning though, they close just before sunset, so you won’t be getting in that golden hour of relaxation.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Beaches in Nice: Including Public and Private Beaches

sources.snippet: Castel Plage is one of the private beaches in Nice and situated by the Baie des Anges. It is a place to be if you desire privacy because it does not usually witness too much crowd. Castel Plage can boast of modern, charming facilities for fun seekers.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Nice France: Welcome to Pebbled Paradise!

sources.snippet: The Castel Plage is one of the popular beaches in Nice, which is found in the Eastern part of the town. You can see private lodges and cheats here. If you find other spots in Nice crowded, the Castel Plage is a great spot due to its secluded location.
sources.shortName: Glamour By The Sea - Most Beautiful Beaches of Nice, France

sources.snippet: Among the many options, we recommend Castel Plage at the foot of Nice Castle, with its spectacular views and excellent restaurant. Alternatively, in Le Galet there is an excellent Italian restaurant and a relaxing and cozy space facing the sea.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Nice, Côte d 'Azur - VOLARE MAGAZINE

places.name: Castel Plage

reviews.text: Came here on a Thursday in July and had an amazing time! Got there for our 9:30am reservation and were taken to our lounge chairs for the day. We had Ben as our waiter who was phenomenal and we appreciated him so much! Very much recommend to anyone looking for a beach club in Nice!

It is definitely a restaurant worth visiting. The food there is great, and the way it's served makes it 10 times better. You also have a great view - right next to the sea, so I would definitely recommend going there a bit later in order to see the sunset! My only problem with the restaurant was the fact that the food was only slightly warm, but since it was warm outside it did not bother me that much.

Best beach for the sea as it is far west of the beach area. Water is always cleanest and crystal clear but a bit colder than the rest due to natural water mix. Fast service with very nice people. I am afraid they have the worst food, never fresh or delicious, I guess due to being busy all the time. They cover a very large area, I don't think any other beach clubs have the same capacity like this one. 35 euros per person without towels that includes umbrella and sun bed. Their sun beds are so close to each other and not possible to move them. The best part of the beach area is they have sun beds with full shade at the back if you prefer. We have reserved online but they don't check for reservation. If you come early and go in the queue, you can always have a place.

places.generalDescription: Plage Beau Rivage Nice is a luxurious beachfront destination located on the Promenade des Anglais, offering a mix of casual and upscale experiences. It features a zen outdoor restaurant with sun beds, as well as a lively lounge area with themed nights and tapas menu. The largest private beach in Nice, it boasts sturdy wood lounge chairs and spacious seating arrangements. With two entrances, one side offers pulsing techno DJ bar and nighttime events while the other end houses an excellent gourmet restaurant.

sources.snippet: Open in season from May to September, Beau Rivage is a private beach with two very different sides: a zen outdoor restaurant opening up to sun beds and the lively lounge area with a new tapas menu and DJ spinning themed nights. Sitting at the foot of the Old Town on the Promenade des Anglais, Beau Rivage (which is open from 10 a.m. to midnight) draws a crowd of locals and tourists thanks to its prime location and sun-lounger menu courtesy of new seaside bistro, The Beachstraw. In the evening, the beach takes on a St. Tropez vibe with seaside soirées featuring themed parties and live music.
sources.shortName: The 10 Best Beaches in Nice, France

sources.snippet: This is the largest private beach in Nice, taking up the equivalent of an entire block, and with two entrances. It is very upscale in every way; for instance the lounge chairs are sturdy wood and not flimsy plastic, and they space out their lounge chairs so you are not in the lap of the person next to you. One entrance features a pulsing techno DJ bar, tapas platters, has a Taittinger Champagne theme going, and hosts lots of nighttime events…  On the other end is the gourmet restaurant, fortified by the culinary staff of the Beau Rivage Hotel, and they do a nice weekday lunch deal for 35€.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Nice 2024

sources.snippet: This is another high-ranking beach as one of the best restaurants in Nice, and similar to Neptune place, it has been awarded the Qualité Tourisme label by the local Chamber of Commerce. You’ll find absolutely extraordinary food here, and it also has very friendly staff, great condition facilities, high-quality food, and drinks, as well as great cleanliness and comfort. In other words, everything you may need for a perfect day on the beach.
sources.shortName: The complete list of The Best Beaches in Nice

sources.snippet: Beau Rivage is the name of a stretch of pebbles-mixed-with-sand, which is public and very popular with young families. If you’re looking for sandy beaches at Nice, check out its extremity near the Paillon River. This stretch also has a private section of the same name, frequented by beachgoers who prefer to casually lay in the sun on comfortable mattresses with a drink in hand.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Beaches In Nice France To Visit

sources.snippet: Beau Rivage seamlessly blends modern amenities with traditional elements, providing a comfortable yet culturally enriched beach experience. From high-end loungers to exquisite local cuisine, every detail is crafted to enhance your beach day. Discover Nice’s secret beaches away from the tourist crowds at this exquisite location.
sources.shortName: A Local’s Guide – NiceFunTours

sources.snippet: Beau Rivage is the perfect spot for a young traveller looking for a lively beach atmosphere. This private beach is located in the heart of Nice and is known for its bustling beach clubs and energetic atmosphere. Beau Rivage offers a range of amenities to make your beach day as comfortable and enjoyable as possible.
sources.siteName: Top Rated Tourist Attraction Places in France | France Travel Pages
sources.shortName: 4 Best Beaches in Nice

sources.snippet: The pretty, retro Plage Beau Rivage is the closest beach club from the old town and is a great family option for a day out on the beach. It’s one of the biggest beach clubs on the promenade with 300+ sunloungers. Despite the size, the beach drinks and food service is rapid.
sources.shortName: Guide to the Best Beach Clubs in Nice

sources.snippet: Beau Rivage beach has been awarded the Qualité Tourisme label by the local Chamber of Commerce. Among the factors considered are the friendliness of staff, condition of facilities, quality of food and drink, cleanliness and overall comfort.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Nice

sources.snippet: Opposite of the Beau Rivage Hotel is the Beau Rivage beach restaurant. Attractive to many people, not just for the use of public toilets, showers and bag storage. For a small fee, you have your hands free to dive in that Azur blue water.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Nice and get the best out of the Côte d'Azur

places.name: Plage Beau Rivage Nice

reviews.text: I had one of the best tagliatelle alle seppie and really a tasty, well made cesar salad. The view itself is amazing! Card payments of course available but the service was way too slow I had to wait between salad and main course around 30 minutes! Rest was good

Mediocre food with mediocre service. The server was annoyed by me. Definitely not worth the money. Only positive thing it's situated on beautiful coast.

I was really looking forward to celebrating my birthday at this restaurant, given its stunning coastal location. While the view was lovely, unfortunately, that was the only highlight of the evening.

The fish and vegetables were a huge disappointment, especially the vegetables, which had an odd, bitter taste. The fish itself felt hastily prepared, and the cheesecake was equally underwhelming, with strange flavors that didn't blend well. The entire meal was a letdown, with the only decent part being the mojito I had.

To make matters worse, I spent nearly 100 euros on this meal, and for that price, I expected much more care and quality. The service was extremely poor. I had to constantly ask the server for basic things like water, which felt ridiculous. Despite being alone at my table, I was practically ignored, having to flag the server down multiple times just to get attention. It felt like they didn't care about me as a customer.

On top of that, I saw the chef walking around chatting with a large table, while my meal seemed hastily thrown together without care or attention to detail. For the price and the overall experience, I doubt I'll be visiting this place again.

Lovely venue, lovely view. Food was fantastic.
The beach was stunning, and beds very comfortable.

The waitor Rayan is absolutely quality, friendly, welcoming, and a pleasure to meet.  Looked after us during our meal and was kind and funny.

Only negative is that, service overall is pretty slow. On the beach we asked a member of staff for drinks he said that he would get "Luke" to come and serve us as it wasn't his responsibility. In the meantime, we waited for ages, then fell asleep, then left hours later, never having been served. Shame really, at the prices they charge, the service should be HOT.

places.generalDescription: Le Galet is a beach club and restaurant located on the picturesque waterfront of Nice. It is part of the renowned Gusto family, known for their successful Italian eateries in the area. The restaurant offers a stylish and relaxed atmosphere where guests can enjoy generous portions of tasty Italian food, including seafood and healthier options like poke bowls. The waterfront terrace provides a perfect setting to savor these dishes while enjoying the soothing sound of waves and fresh sea air.

sources.snippet: One of the newer private beaches to debut on Nice’s shores, Le Galet, named after the Côte d’Azur’s galets, or pebbles, is the epitome of Riviera chic. Think zen-like wooden shutters, navy beach beds, and sleek white parasols extending down to the sea. Officially open in season (April to October), the restaurant and beach bar welcome the lunch crowd as soon as the weather gets warm, which happens quite quickly in Nice.
sources.shortName: The 10 Best Beaches in Nice, France

sources.snippet: Le Galet is a trendy private beach located on the famous Promenade des Anglais. It offers a breathtaking view of the sea and the surrounding cliffs, while bringing a touch of luxury to your day spent at the beach. With comfortable sun loungers and enticing double beds, this beach is the perfect spot for a day of reading or listening to your favourite podcast.
sources.shortName: 20 Beautiful Beaches & Beach Clubs in Nice, France (2025)

sources.snippet: For fans of boats but prone to seasickness, Le Galet, furnished and decorated with yacht decor, will mimic a cruise ship experience while ensuring that your feet stand on solid grounds. This Nice beach is named after the many pebbles that inhabit the city, and here, the atmosphere is friendlier and more relaxed than what you might expect.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Beaches In Nice France To Visit

sources.snippet: One of a crop of new owners of old beaches, this one is named after the famous smooth stones… les galets. It is part of the Gusto family of renown local Italian eateries: La Voglia and La Favola in Old Nice, and Boccaccio on rue Massena, so their culinary track record is good. Top Italian cuisine, Milan-chic ambiance.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Nice 2024

sources.snippet: Le Galet is a beach club along the Mediterranean that’s perfect for anyone looking to spend the day relaxing with a good view, and great service. Book a table or lounge early if you’re visiting during the summer, as this place gets busy fast. It’s especially lovely for a late lunch or day of tanning and drinking.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Beaches in Nice: Including Public and Private Beaches

sources.snippet: Le Galet is opposite Albert-ler Gardens and offers foods as well as drinks in addition to a cosy beach setting. The design of this beach is Italian and you can’t help but catch fun to the fullest. In addition to the fresh that is provided at this beach, you will also get access to various social events.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Nice France: Welcome to Pebbled Paradise!

sources.snippet: Le Galet is named after the pebbles that make up the city’s beaches. It is a high-end new offering close to Albert-1er Gardens with as many dining options as its beachy setting. The design at Galet is essentially Italian, while the setting hosts major social events for a decent part of the year.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Nice

sources.snippet: If you can't visit the Boot during your stay in the southeast of France, head to the private beach Le Galet; you'll get a taste of Italy!. Le Galet has a restaurant with a refined Mediterranean menu that includes all the most delicious Italian dishes. For starters, try the burrata mozzarella.
sources.shortName: Top 5 private beaches in Nice

sources.snippet: A beach, lounge bar and restaurant, the décor imitates a cruise-ship or yacht experience, with ropes, large wooden panels and huge pergola. The Galet puts comfort and style first. Sit just metres from the water and enjoy a beautiful lunch in a quiet and intimate atmosphere.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Nice: Top Spots for Sun & Sea

sources.snippet: In Nice, it is impossible to use the expression “fine sandbanks”. All along the coast, the seashores are strewn with pebbles polished by the sea. What better name than “the pebble” to designate this pretty private beach.
sources.shortName: Private beaches in Nice: our guide to the best addresses!

places.name: Le Galet

reviews.text: We stumbled upon this restaurant while walking along the beach, and it turned out to be an excellent choice. We didn't have a reservation, so we waited about 30 minutes but during that time, they seated us on the beach chairs where we enjoyed a drink while the kids played by the sea and we took in the beautiful view. Once we were seated, we ordered the linguine with seafood, grilled octopus tentacles, Caesar salad, and pizza. Everything was absolutely delicious, and the warm, friendly service made the experience even better. We had a wonderful time here and would definitely come back!

We lined up at 9am to get daybeds at Le Galet and also had made a lunch reservation several days beforehand. We got the last daybeds, so would recommend lining up before 9am if you're trying to get daybeds (they don't take daybed reservations). It was a beautiful place and the a classy but chill crowd. The staff was very helpful. They do charge extra if you want to rent towels in addition to the daybeds, or you can bring your own towels.

As for lunch, the server was very friendly and helpful. Similar chill, classy, beach vibes at lunch. Reservation is recommended if you're trying to go during the height of the lunch hour. The Caesar salad was awesome and came with chicken. The tuna was good too, but the Caesar was better. The table over got the pizza which looked really good too.

Galet was the perfect beach day in Nice. The amenities were top-notch-comfortable loungers, great service, and easy access to the water. We stayed for lunch and were blown away by how fresh and flavorful everything was. From the seafood to the salads, every dish felt thoughtful and high quality. Add in the stunning sea views, and it's hard to imagine a better spot to relax, eat, and soak up the Riviera sun. Highly recommend!

We were able to reserve a spot through our hotel but get here early to get a spot since I believe they do not take reservations

places.generalDescription: Ponchettes Public Beach is a vibrant and popular spot in Nice, located near the city's charming old town. The beach offers a picturesque setting with palm tree-lined shores and access to the lively Marche Aux Fleurs Cours Saleya flower market. Visitors can enjoy the sunny weather year-round and indulge in luxury amenities provided by nearby hotels. While the beach can get crowded, it's worth arriving early to secure a prime spot by the water.

sources.snippet: Ponchettes Beach, located on the seafront facing the old town of Nice, is mainly composed of pebbles. Numerous amenities are available, such as a space for playing beach volleyball. Swimming is supervised during the summer season.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Nice, France – The best beaches

sources.snippet: If you are unsure of your health condition, go to this beach and you will have the full attention of the lifeguards. If you feel sporty, join a volleyball game in the fenced court on the sandy beach. There’s also a first-aid post.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Nice and get the best out of the Côte d'Azur

places.name: Ponchettes Public Beach

reviews.text: Nice enjoyable place to stay but bring a few towels or chairs as the beach has large rocks. Need water shoes as the entry to water is steep and hard on the feet. Water clean and refreshing!

The classic open-air beachside lunch spot. It's right on the sand (actually more like pebbles, but with a floor) so you feel the sweet sea breezes and gaze out at the beautiful blue-green Côte d'Azur just steps away. The menu is more than plentiful for lunch; salad options, seafood salads, pizzas and more. Nice assortment of cocktails too.
Out Niçoise salad was huge, with big chunks of tuna throughout, and my tuna sushi rolls - while pretty small -  were delicious. Service is prompt and prices are on the high side but reasonable for the location. Recommend

Came here for dinner recently as a celebration and was, in all honesty, a little let down. Going into this place we had seen the menu so we were aware of the upmarket prices and so I would say had expectations in line with this.
Most prices were around the €30 mark (starters and a few main options) but these do go up to towards €100 for other dishes and specials. I have read a lot of complaints about these prices but if that's what they want to charge and they think the ingredients are worth; it is displayed before you take a seat and is somewhat expected due to location. Saying this €8 for a soft drink is DOUBLE what we have found most places chrage for the same drink. I wouldn't say the food is bad by any means and I did quite enjoy the very cheesy margarita pizza (one of the 2 vegetarian dishes and probably the cheapest main meal option).
My problem however is more within the details you would expect from an up market place like this one. To start the server seemed a little dismissive especially when not ever member of the table wanted to order a drink from the menu. We felt as if there was a contrast between the service offered to our table and that to those of who we presumed to be locals. This became apparent as our server asked the table next to us if their food was okay but not ours. I suppose this could be simply due to a language barrier or if it was something to do with the "type" of people they assumed us to be.

Other small details I think this restaurant could work on include serving the bread with butter or oil (and at a minimum providing a small plate so we didn't cover the table in crumbs before the mains). As well as potentially revising the menu slightly as I felt the vegetation options were very minimal and boring.

In summary; I felt as if this place charge more money than the overall experience is worth. I believe if they revisited small aspects (specially relating to service) it would make the prices feel much more reasonable. The venue and the food are not necessarily lacking but I am confident to say that you would be able to find similar quality food with much better service at a fraction of the price at any other restaurant that is not located right on the beach.

p.s As has already been mentioned this does not feel like the type of place it would be acceptable to share dishes or drinks between guests. There is definitely a sense of pressure to spend a large amount of money per person.
